snippet: Taliban fighters defended the Tirah Valley, which they acquired last month, killing about 30 soldiers in Pakistan’s army over five days.
abstract: Taliban fighters defended Tirah Valley in Pakistan, which they acquired in March, killing about 30 soldiers in country’s army over five days.

byline.contributor: Ismail Khan contributed reporting from Peshawar, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: Taliban fighters defended the Tirah Valley, which they acquired last month, killing about 30 soldiers in Pakistan’s army over five days.

headline.seo: Taliban Defend New Perch in Northern Pakistan
headline.main: Taliban Defend New Perch in Northern Pakistan, Gaining Sway as Election Nears
headline.print_headline: Taliban Defend New Perch in Northern Pakistan, Gaining Sway as Election Nears
